Earth's protective ozone layer has not fully recovered from damage, in part due to manmade chemicals. The UV Index was invented by Environment and Climate Change Canada scientists in 1992 in response to concerns over the thinning middle ozone layer.

articles.title: Pakistan issues health warning on CCHF and heatstroke risks
articles.summary: Pakistan's National Institute of Health has released advisories about Crimean-Congo Haemorrhagic Fever (CCHF) and increased heatstroke risks. CCHF is a serious viral disease caused by the Nairovirus. It spreads to humans mainly through infected ticks found on livestock. In 2024, Pakistan reported 61 cases of the disease.

articles.title: Experts raise concerns after observing unprecedented change in species: 'It shouldn't be here'
articles.author: Yei Ling Ma
articles.summary: Rising global temperatures have contributed to unpredictable weather events, but wildlife is doing its best to adapt to the changing climate. Songbirds that used to migrate to warmer climates during winter have been spotted in Maine year-round, as the state experiences shorter and milder winters. Red-bellied woodpeckers and Carolina wrens are also common in Maine.

articles.title: Letter: You can't defeat mother nature
articles.author: Letters to the Editor
articles.summary: Earth's wobble, known as axial procession, takes approximately 26,000 years to complete a full rotation. It influences the amount of solar radiation received regionally, causing fluctuations in temperature. California wildfires used to burn up to 4 million acres a year, but now they burn 11 million acres in a single year. Easing into cleaner energy would be more beneficial than slamming the door on 'big oil'.

articles.author: Sarah Kaplan

Human activity is exacerbating the risk of sea-level rise. In New Zealand, shorelines are subsiding or sinking, which means rising seas will affect coastal areas sooner.

articles.title: Africa Hit by Extreme Weather - More Floods, Landslides to Come
articles.summary: Flooding has caused widespread devastation in several parts of Africa. Millions have been impacted and thousands of lives have been lost. articles.title: Record-High 48% Call Global Warming a Serious Threat

articles.title: Commentary: The vegan butterfly effect
articles.author: Rebecca Libauskas
articles.summary: The number of butterflies in the U.S. has declined by around 22% since 2000. Raising and killing animals for food destroys the forests, grasslands and wetlands that animals like butterflies need to survive. Animal agriculture uses 80% of global farmland but provides only 17% of the world's calories. A shift to vegan eating could free 240 million acres of farmland and provide critical habitat for butterflies.

articles.summary: Extensive coral bleaching has been confirmed at Australia's Great Barrier Reef for the sixth time in less than a decade. articles.summary: As climate change intensifies, people in upper Swat are being forced to leave their ancestral homes and leave behind a fading cultural legacy due to recurring glacial lake outburst floods (Glofs) caused by melting glaciers.
